documents.document: @seanofiachra will have to agree to differ but if people want equity (/ equality & in every sense including income) they need to vote for it
@seanofiachra I wish we could have for eg banned schools charging fees, national health service, declared all schools multi d etc -next time
@seanofiachra we stabilised the Country's finances by reducing deficit from 30% to 2.3%, finally legislated for x, put marriage referendum
@seanofiachra @kenfoxe and i'd nationalise all private hospitals!
@seanofiachra @kenfoxe also I would ban doctors working in public from working in private health
@seanofiachra @kenfoxe Sean not sure I understand your last question - if I had my way id only allow one list for all operations
@seanofiachra @kenfoxe Sean lots of employees can avail of group schemes at work which they pay into
@kenfoxe @seanofiachra Ken that settles that question. Also re financial necessity some TDs have been in debt, even insolvent- can't presume
@kenfoxe @seanofiachra or any organ transplant - not aware of private lists for same
@kenfoxe @seanofiachra what if they needed a liver transplant for example?
@kenfoxe @seanofiachra sorry that was addressed to Ken
@kenfoxe @seanofiachra Sean you pay for any scheme you get. It's not unusual for workplaces to source a scheme workers pay into
@seanofiachra @kenfoxe Sean There are no expenses paid for private health insurance. Ken I'm sure has checked this out
@kenfoxe @seanofiachra for example some operations are only public to my knowledge
@kenfoxe @seanofiachra no they don't get private as a perk and Ken many TDs and Senators and or family do run the gauntlet of public
@AnGiogoir though we do need to teach our children to question what they read. Many people unquestionably believe unbelievable stories
Good advice for us all https://t.co/yOBElRduEk
@kenfoxe the abolition of water charges goes against that
@kenfoxe that's true actually but then they do that without being told the corporations will pay more
@jayjaycafe I doubt we're going to come to a consensus on this
@kenfoxe plus@much of it is suggested in rhetoric similar to Trumps - ordinary people versus " the establishment"
@jayjaycafe You've a lot of faith in unknown unelected technocrats
@kenfoxe you think? That's not what they are being promised - the rich will pay (including corporations) so you don't have to
@jayjaycafe and you are wrong elected people are sacked at elections
@jayjaycafe and who sacks them? Voters can't
@JFTAXI @kenfoxe @andreakirwan @UnitedEire2016 it's populist to always say someone else will pay
@JFTAXI @kenfoxe @andreakirwan @UnitedEire2016 John it's not an either or - the answer that somebody else will pay is populist and false
When most Council houses wer built it was because Councils borrowed to build houses #vinb https://t.co/LDHPq3w9LU
@andreakirwan @UnitedEire2016 @kenfoxe if they were paid less it wouldn't address need for EU tax levels to be paid for EU levels of service
@kenfoxe or the hypocrisy of demanding the abolition of water charges as the priority
@EidinNiShe @juneshannon also people need to face up to what needs to be invested in health & that paying for it may mean paying more taxes
@anbealach Anne if we had not made those choices we would be like Greece
@anbealach more than what people are prepared to pay in taxes
@anbealach which was more important - investing more in our Heath services or getting rid of water charges?
@anbealach because they were guaranteed and even if no banking crisis the recession meant less taxes to pay for services
@anbealach do you think there was invisible money out there?
@anbealach I understand that but ultimately the voters get their say (and even though I fell foul of that I would not have it any other way)
@anbealach true I don't - and I'm older than you think! As Churchill said democracy is worse form of Government except for all others
@anbealach you're not a big fan
@anbealach your not a big fan of democracy
@anbealach and how are you going to hold unelected people who do things you disagree with to account?
@HangBlaa good! Glad to hear it!
@HangBlaa in otherwise don't ask questions. Strange coming from you
@HangBlaa where did I claim bias?
@HangBlaa I'd need locus standi but RTE are not beyond criticism/questioning in public discourse (or have you abandoned being a sceptic?)
@HangBlaa that's how the law works - the detail is not necessarily spelt out in laws/codes and courts/adjudicators interpret them!
@HangBlaa interpretation -sometimes RTE have had complaints against them upheld despite the defence you suggest here https://t.co/7gYpcMiQ6l
@HangBlaa not suggesting all parties be represented but there is supposed to be some semblance to proportion of parties/Indos in the Dail
@ismaithanfear and what about the PBP?
@HangBlaa I think there is an element of both in general but that programmes of this genre are expected to have balance.
@kevinlydon1 in the 14 years I was in the Oireachtas I was never invited to be on the panel #twip
#twip has two Independent TDs and one FF TD on its panel tonight - how is that balanced?
Who will appoint the private sector people tasked with interviewing and selecting State Board applicants? #twip
@COTTAGEinEIRE @electionlit 2) Labour was the only party to have as its policy for the 2011 General Election that it would have a referendum
@COTTAGEinEIRE @electionlit 1) the leaflet is by GLEN & printed before the referendum & is about our record on LGBT issues from1993 to 2014
@peter_swane @electionlit note also it predates the referendum
@peter_swane @electionlit it's a good leaflet too and not by us. Maybe it's a lesson in itself. Sets out the provenance of our efforts
@COTTAGEinEIRE @electionlit in the vote on the referendum yes, but a Constitutional referendum can only be proposed by the Oireachtas
2014 GLEN leaflet "The Labour Party and the Remarkable Journey towards Equality and Civil Marriageâ€¦ https://t.co/WLOGNFX1jd via @electionlit
@NatOneFamilyNet @brady460 @SparkIreland @labour @publicpolicyie agree, but it can't always be the State subsidising employers as the answer
@NatOneFamilyNet @brady460 @SparkIreland @labour a lot of people are worse off than the average wage - see here https://t.co/ktLnsM5Gqn
@NatOneFamilyNet @brady460 @SparkIreland @labour FF/FG/AAA-PBP/SF/Independent will sort that out I'm sure
@NatOneFamilyNet @brady460 @SparkIreland I have family members in that situation & was unemployed & in community employment last recession
@NatOneFamilyNet @brady460 @SparkIreland @labour those working and on FIS are at less risk of poverty than those on OPFP, JST etc
@NatOneFamilyNet @brady460 @SparkIreland that's true although most politicians in Ireland don't come from well off backgrounds not families
@brady460 @SparkIreland @labour i.e. Those lone parents at least at risk of poverty
@brady460 @SparkIreland @labour I knew that all along and that Sparks largely represented those that already qualified for FIS
@BarbaraMSmyth ok. I hope we don't end up with another Boom and Bust and have learned and don't forget
@LaobhaoiseNihE Susie is from Cavan originally
@BarbaraMSmyth although FF in power then too
@BarbaraMSmyth I bought mine in my thirties having finished college during the last recession & long time unemployed after graduation
@benmorby @AodhBC see that someone got there first! Great minds and all that
@AodhBC your right their
@DeirdreFlannery @SparkIreland @KZapponeTD @FineGael it is and there have been improvements by last Gov and present Gov has announced some
@SparkIreland @labour seems to be very low key compared to your campaign against Labour!
@RoryHearne what do the far left and far right have in common? - they blame the "establishment"
@RoryHearne @r_o_farrell although I appreciate it won't suit your political agenda to give the full picture
@SparkIreland @labour showing your true colours - not prepared to hold current Government to account because Labour not in Government
@RoryHearne @r_o_farrell it was the crash that caused job losses and we were not in Government until afterward to clean up the mess
Dublin Mid West Traders - South Dublin County Council has launched its Shopfront Grant Scheme for 2017 https://t.co/Zbf3VbZ71z
@jlpobrien @r_o_farrell @RoryHearne and that's understandable considering there was a recession and job losses in the hundred of thousands
NUI graduates - register to vote in Seanad elections at this link https://t.co/DKyW3DbAX2
@r_o_farrell @RoryHearne does that map not show the legacy of decades of emigration?
@RoryHearne @lorcafan does that map would show legacy of historical emigration and not just what happened during recession?
@SparkIreland it's the Government you should be holding to account now - where's your campaign now to get changes reversed by them?
Income inequality fell in 2015 according to the Survey on Income and Living Conditions for 2015 https://t.co/sLTfBDMOUE
Well worth watching for the full 16 minutes -Kenneth Clarke's barnstorming speech on triggering Article 50 https://t.co/x0zogCT5jT

@cillian32 did Louise O'Reilly pay hers?
@feardeas thanks Declan
Looking forward to campaigning today in Lucan as part of Labour's National Recruitment campaign #LabourRebuild https://t.co/9IYctLcIcE
Well done @SusieMcGowan85 and #clerys workers for seeking greater protections for employees faced with redundancies in future #generationFD
@PMc276 @Ciairin @Rubberbandits @JillianvT @CathalMacCoille there you go
@peter_swane Brendan and the party are doing good work at the moment to rebuild so give us a chance
@peter_swane @Ciairin @Rubberbandits @CathalMacCoille you never know. He is a good TD
@Ciairin @Rubberbandits @JillianvT @CathalMacCoille true but there's human interest.That she has young children is something SF will promote
